a large city in the southern part of Japan: In August 1945, the United States dropped atomic bombs on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, killing huge numbers of civilians. The Hiroshima Peace Memorial Museum welcomes 1.4 million visitors every year.
More examplesFewer examplesWe arrived in Hiroshima the following morning.He lives in a small town 20 miles from Hiroshima.The Olympic flame was lit by Yoshinori Sakai, who had been born on August 6, 1945, in Hiroshima.
